projects.name: Penn Mobile
projects.description: As part of Penn Labs, I work as Team Lead for the Backend Team of the Penn Mobile application. Penn Mobile serves over 10,000 monthly users and helps the Penn community with their day-to-day life at Penn. Some of the services the app offers include booking study rooms, providing analytics on their dining hall usage, information on laundry, and more.

projects.name: Martian
projects.description: Martian is a startup focused on using NLP to create powerful tools in education. As a full-stack developer for Martian, I build features on the user interface and design RESTful API on the backend. Currently, I am focused on the LTI integration of our product so that other learning tools are easily able to use our product.

projects.name: PennOS
projects.description: PennOS is a simple operating system I built as part of a team 5 for my Operating Systems class. It is built in C and is based on the Linux kernel. It supports priority scheduling, foreground/background processes, stdin/stdout redirections, job control, reading and writing to files, creating and deleting files, and more.

projects.name: Forecasting Stock Prices
projects.description: As part of a team of 3, I worked on a project to predict stock prices using machine learning. We tried out a variety of models including random forests and CNNs before settling on an ensemble of an ARIMA model and a Transformer to predict future stock prices based on a variable amount of input data.

projects.name: Book Nexus
projects.description: Book Nexus is a web application that allows users to explore different books and authors. It involved creating complex recommendation algorithms based on user favorites and optimizing those queries to be as fast as possible. I also set up a CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions to automatically deploy our application whenever its repository was pushed to.

projects.name: Whitespace Compiler
projects.description: As part of a team of 3, I created a compiler in Haskell for an esoteric language called Whitespace. It worked by first parsing the Whitespace syntax into our internal data type representation of the language, and then translating that language into ARM Assembly. My team and I extensively tested the accuracy of the code using property-based testing (QuickCheck) and unit tests.

projects.name: Smart Contract Dashboard
projects.description: This was a website that I built as part of my job as a research assistant in the summer of 2023. It served as a dashboard that allowed the researchers to watch certain Ethereum smart contracts and automatically run fuzzing programs on recently launched contracts.

projects.name: Perspecio
projects.description: Perspecio was a fun 3D flappy-bird styled game I designed back when COVID ruined all my plans. I developed it using the Unity game engine and coded the game in C#. I also designed a leaderboard system to work with the WebGL version of the game in JavaScript, PHP, and MySQL.

projects.name: ACEs Assessment
projects.description: The ACEs Assessment website is a tool I developed that used used Vanderbilt's Pediatric ACEs Algorithm to automate tailored responses to parents and reduce the risk of their child disciplining techniques creating Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs).
